trans-unit.source: Behind your UI are your business and data layers.
trans-unit.target: Behind your UI are your business and data layers.

trans-unit.source: Porting Windows Phone Silverlight business and data layers to UWP
trans-unit.target: Porting Windows Phone Silverlight business and data layers to UWP

trans-unit.source: Porting Windows Phone Silverlight business and data layers to UWP
trans-unit.target: Porting Windows Phone Silverlight business and data layers to UWP

trans-unit.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)

trans-unit.source: The previous topic was [Porting for I/O, device, and app model](wpsl-to-uwp-input-and-sensors.md).
trans-unit.target: The previous topic was [Porting for I/O, device, and app model](wpsl-to-uwp-input-and-sensors.md).

trans-unit.source: Behind your UI are your business and data layers.
trans-unit.target: Behind your UI are your business and data layers.

trans-unit.source: The code in these layers calls operating system and .NET Framework APIs (for example, background processing, location, the camera, the file system, network, and other data access).
trans-unit.target: The code in these layers calls operating system and .NET Framework APIs (for example, background processing, location, the camera, the file system, network, and other data access).

trans-unit.source: The vast majority of those are [available to a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br211369), so you can expect to be able to port much of this code without change.
trans-unit.target: The vast majority of those are [available to a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br211369), so you can expect to be able to port much of this code without change.

trans-unit.source: Asynchronous methods
trans-unit.target: Asynchronous methods

trans-unit.source: One of the priorities of the Universal Windows Platform (UWP) is to enable you to build apps that are truly, and consistently, responsive.
trans-unit.target: One of the priorities of the Universal Windows Platform (UWP) is to enable you to build apps that are truly, and consistently, responsive.

trans-unit.source: Animations are always smooth, and touch interactions such as panning and swiping are instantaneous and free of lag, making it feel like the UI is glued to your finger.
trans-unit.target: Animations are always smooth, and touch interactions such as panning and swiping are instantaneous and free of lag, making it feel like the UI is glued to your finger.

trans-unit.source: To achieve this, any UWP API that can't guarantee to complete within 50ms has been made asynchronous and its name suffixed with **Async**.
trans-unit.target: To achieve this, any UWP API that can't guarantee to complete within 50ms has been made asynchronous and its name suffixed with **Async**.

trans-unit.source: Your UI thread will return immediately from calling an **Async** method, and the work will take place on another thread.
trans-unit.target: Your UI thread will return immediately from calling an **Async** method, and the work will take place on another thread.

trans-unit.source: Consuming an **Async** method is made very easy, syntactically, using the C# **await** operator, JavaScript promise objects, and C++ continuations.
trans-unit.target: Consuming an **Async** method is made very easy, syntactically, using the C# **await** operator, JavaScript promise objects, and C++ continuations.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see [Asynchronous programming](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt187335).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see [Asynchronous programming](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt187335).

trans-unit.source: Background processing
trans-unit.target: Background processing

trans-unit.source: A Windows Phone Silverlight app can use a managed **ScheduledTaskAgent** object to perform a task while the app is not in the foreground.
trans-unit.target: A Windows Phone Silverlight app can use a managed **ScheduledTaskAgent** object to perform a task while the app is not in the foreground.

trans-unit.source: A UWP app uses the [**BackgroundTaskBuilder**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224768) class to create and register a background task in a similar way.
trans-unit.target: A UWP app uses the [**BackgroundTaskBuilder**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224768) class to create and register a background task in a similar way.

trans-unit.source: You define a class that implements the work of your background task.
trans-unit.target: You define a class that implements the work of your background task.

trans-unit.source: The system runs your background task periodically, calling the [**Run**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224811) method of your class to execute the work.
trans-unit.target: The system runs your background task periodically, calling the [**Run**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224811) method of your class to execute the work.

trans-unit.source: In a UWP app, remember to set the **Background Tasks** declaration in the app package manifest.
trans-unit.target: In a UWP app, remember to set the **Background Tasks** declaration in the app package manifest.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see [Support your app with background tasks](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt299103).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see [Support your app with background tasks](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt299103).

trans-unit.source: To transfer large data files in the background, a Windows Phone Silverlight app uses the **BackgroundTransferService** class.
trans-unit.target: To transfer large data files in the background, a Windows Phone Silverlight app uses the **BackgroundTransferService** class.

trans-unit.source: A UWP app uses APIs in the [**Windows.Networking.BackgroundTransfer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207242) namespace to do this.
trans-unit.target: A UWP app uses APIs in the [**Windows.Networking.BackgroundTransfer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207242) namespace to do this.

trans-unit.source: The features use a similar pattern to initiate transfers, but the new API has improved capabilities and performance.
trans-unit.target: The features use a similar pattern to initiate transfers, but the new API has improved capabilities and performance.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see [Transferring data in the background](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/hh452975).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see [Transferring data in the background](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/hh452975).

trans-unit.source: A Windows Phone Silverlight app uses the managed classes in the **Microsoft.Phone.BackgroundAudio** namespace to play audio while the app is not in the foreground.
trans-unit.target: A Windows Phone Silverlight app uses the managed classes in the **Microsoft.Phone.BackgroundAudio** namespace to play audio while the app is not in the foreground.

trans-unit.source: The UWP uses the Windows Phone Store app model, see [Background Audio](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt282140) and the [Background audio](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619997) sample.
trans-unit.target: The UWP uses the Windows Phone Store app model, see [Background Audio](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt282140) and the [Background audio](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619997) sample.

trans-unit.source: Cloud services, networking, and databases
trans-unit.target: Cloud services, networking, and databases

trans-unit.source: Hosting data and app services in the cloud is possible using Azure.
trans-unit.target: Hosting data and app services in the cloud is possible using Azure.

trans-unit.source: See [Getting Started with Mobile Services](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=403138).
trans-unit.target: See [Getting Started with Mobile Services](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=403138).

trans-unit.source: For solutions that require both online and offline data see: [Using offline data sync in Mobile Services](http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/mobile-services-windows-store-dotnet-get-started-offline-data/).
trans-unit.target: For solutions that require both online and offline data see: [Using offline data sync in Mobile Services](http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/mobile-services-windows-store-dotnet-get-started-offline-data/).

trans-unit.source: The UWP has partial support for the **System.Net.HttpWebRequest** class, but the **System.Net.WebClient** class is not supported.
trans-unit.target: The UWP has partial support for the **System.Net.HttpWebRequest** class, but the **System.Net.WebClient** class is not supported.

trans-unit.source: The recommended, forward-looking alternative is the [**Windows.Web.Http.HttpClient**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298639) class (or [System.Net.Http.HttpClient](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.net.http.httpclient(v=vs.118).aspx) if you need your code to be portable to other platforms that support .NET).
trans-unit.target: The recommended, forward-looking alternative is the [**Windows.Web.Http.HttpClient**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298639) class (or [System.Net.Http.HttpClient](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.net.http.httpclient(v=vs.118).aspx) if you need your code to be portable to other platforms that support .NET).

trans-unit.source: These APIs use [System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.net.http.httprequestmessage.aspx) to represent an HTTP request.
trans-unit.target: These APIs use [System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.net.http.httprequestmessage.aspx) to represent an HTTP request.

trans-unit.source: UWP apps do not currently include built-in support for data-intensive scenarios such as line of business (LOB) scenarios.
trans-unit.target: UWP apps do not currently include built-in support for data-intensive scenarios such as line of business (LOB) scenarios.

trans-unit.source: However, you can make use SQLite for local transactional database services.
trans-unit.target: However, you can make use SQLite for local transactional database services.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see [SQLite](https://visualstudiogallery.msdn.microsoft.com/4913e7d5-96c9-4dde-a1a1-69820d615936).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see [SQLite](https://visualstudiogallery.msdn.microsoft.com/4913e7d5-96c9-4dde-a1a1-69820d615936).

trans-unit.source: Pass absolute URIs, not relative URIs, to Windows Runtime types.
trans-unit.target: Pass absolute URIs, not relative URIs, to Windows Runtime types.

trans-unit.source: See [Passing a URI to the Windows Runtime](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/hh763341.aspx).
trans-unit.target: See [Passing a URI to the Windows Runtime](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/hh763341.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Launchers and Choosers
trans-unit.target: Launchers and Choosers

trans-unit.source: With Launchers and Choosers (found in the **Microsoft.Phone.Tasks** namespace), a Windows Phone Silverlight app can interact with the operating system to perform common operations such as composing an email, choosing a photo, or sharing certain kinds of data with another app.
trans-unit.target: With Launchers and Choosers (found in the **Microsoft.Phone.Tasks** namespace), a Windows Phone Silverlight app can interact with the operating system to perform common operations such as composing an email, choosing a photo, or sharing certain kinds of data with another app.

trans-unit.source: Search for **Microsoft.Phone.Tasks** in the topic [Windows Phone Silverlight to Windows 10 namespace and class mappings](wpsl-to-uwp-namespace-and-class-mappings.md) to find the equivalent UWP type.
trans-unit.target: Search for **Microsoft.Phone.Tasks** in the topic [Windows Phone Silverlight to Windows 10 namespace and class mappings](wpsl-to-uwp-namespace-and-class-mappings.md) to find the equivalent UWP type.

trans-unit.source: These range from similar mechanisms, called launchers and pickers, to implementing a contract for sharing data between apps.
trans-unit.target: These range from similar mechanisms, called launchers and pickers, to implementing a contract for sharing data between apps.

trans-unit.source: A Windows Phone Silverlight app can be put into a dormant state or even tombstoned when using, for example, the photo Chooser task.
trans-unit.target: A Windows Phone Silverlight app can be put into a dormant state or even tombstoned when using, for example, the photo Chooser task.

trans-unit.source: A UWP app remains active and running while using the [**FileOpenPicker**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207847) class.
trans-unit.target: A UWP app remains active and running while using the [**FileOpenPicker**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207847) class.

trans-unit.source: Monetization (trial mode and in-app purchases)
trans-unit.target: Monetization (trial mode and in-app purchases)

trans-unit.source: A Windows Phone Silverlight app can use the UWP [**CurrentApp**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh779765) class for most of its trial mode and in-app purchase functionality, so that code doesn't need to be ported.
trans-unit.target: A Windows Phone Silverlight app can use the UWP [**CurrentApp**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh779765) class for most of its trial mode and in-app purchase functionality, so that code doesn't need to be ported.

trans-unit.source: But, a Windows Phone Silverlight app calls **MarketplaceDetailTask.Show** to offer the app for purchase:
trans-unit.target: But, a Windows Phone Silverlight app calls **MarketplaceDetailTask.Show** to offer the app for purchase:

trans-unit.source: Port that code to call the UWP [**RequestAppPurchaseAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh967813) method:
trans-unit.target: Port that code to call the UWP [**RequestAppPurchaseAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh967813) method:

trans-unit.source: If you have code that simulates your app purchase and in-app purchase features for testing purposes, then you can port that to use the [**CurrentAppSimulator**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh779766) class instead.
trans-unit.target: If you have code that simulates your app purchase and in-app purchase features for testing purposes, then you can port that to use the [**CurrentAppSimulator**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh779766) class instead.

trans-unit.source: Notifications for tile or toast updates
trans-unit.target: Notifications for tile or toast updates

trans-unit.source: Notifications are an extension of the push notification model for Windows Phone Silverlight apps.
trans-unit.target: Notifications are an extension of the push notification model for Windows Phone Silverlight apps.

trans-unit.source: When you receive a notification from the Windows Push Notification Service (WNS), you can surface the info to the UI with a tile update or with a toast.
trans-unit.target: When you receive a notification from the Windows Push Notification Service (WNS), you can surface the info to the UI with a tile update or with a toast.

trans-unit.source: For porting the UI side of your notification features, see [Tiles and toasts](w8x-to-uwp-porting-xaml-and-ui.md#tiles-and-toasts).
trans-unit.target: For porting the UI side of your notification features, see [Tiles and toasts](w8x-to-uwp-porting-xaml-and-ui.md#tiles-and-toasts).

trans-unit.source: For more details on the use of notifications in a UWP app, see [Sending toast notifications](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/hh868266).
trans-unit.target: For more details on the use of notifications in a UWP app, see [Sending toast notifications](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/hh868266).

trans-unit.source: For info and tutorials on using tiles, toasts, badges, banners, and notifications in a Windows Runtime app using C++, C#, or Visual Basic, see [Working with tiles, badges, and toast notifications](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/hh868259).
trans-unit.target: For info and tutorials on using tiles, toasts, badges, banners, and notifications in a Windows Runtime app using C++, C#, or Visual Basic, see [Working with tiles, badges, and toast notifications](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/hh868259).

trans-unit.source: Storage (file access)
trans-unit.target: Storage (file access)

trans-unit.source: Windows Phone Silverlight code that stores app settings as key-value pairs in isolated storage is easily ported.
trans-unit.target: Windows Phone Silverlight code that stores app settings as key-value pairs in isolated storage is easily ported.

trans-unit.source: Here is a before-and-after example, first the Windows Phone Silverlight version:
trans-unit.target: Here is a before-and-after example, first the Windows Phone Silverlight version:

trans-unit.source: And the UWP equivalent:
trans-unit.target: And the UWP equivalent:

trans-unit.source: Although a subset of the **Windows.Storage** namespace is available to them, many Windows Phone Silverlight apps perform file i/o with the **IsolatedStorageFile** class because it has been supported for longer.
trans-unit.target: Although a subset of the **Windows.Storage** namespace is available to them, many Windows Phone Silverlight apps perform file i/o with the **IsolatedStorageFile** class because it has been supported for longer.

trans-unit.source: Assuming that **IsolatedStorageFile** is being used, here's a before-and-after example of writing and reading a file, first the Windows Phone Silverlight version:
trans-unit.target: Assuming that **IsolatedStorageFile** is being used, here's a before-and-after example of writing and reading a file, first the Windows Phone Silverlight version:

trans-unit.source: And the same functionality using the UWP:
trans-unit.target: And the same functionality using the UWP:

trans-unit.source: A Windows Phone Silverlight app has read-only access to the optional SD card.
trans-unit.target: A Windows Phone Silverlight app has read-only access to the optional SD card.

trans-unit.source: A UWP app has read-write access to the SD card.
trans-unit.target: A UWP app has read-write access to the SD card.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see [Access the SD card](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt188699).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see [Access the SD card](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt188699).

trans-unit.source: For info about accessing photos, music, and video files in a UWP app, see [Files and folders in the Music, Pictures, and Videos libraries](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt188703).
trans-unit.target: For info about accessing photos, music, and video files in a UWP app, see [Files and folders in the Music, Pictures, and Videos libraries](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt188703).

trans-unit.source: For more info, see [Files, folders, and libraries](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt185399).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see [Files, folders, and libraries](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt185399).

trans-unit.target: The next topic is [Porting for form factor and UX](wpsl-to-uwp-form-factors-and-ux.md).
